Sentencas: The instability of the surface chemistry in transition metal oxide perovskites is the main factor hindering the long-term durability of oxygen electrodes in solid oxide electrochemical cells.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: The instability of surface chemistry is mainly due to the segregation of A-site dopants from the lattice to the surface.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: Here we report that cathodic potential can remarkably improve the stability in oxygen reduction reaction and electrochemical activity, by decomposing the near-surface region of the perovskite phase in a porous electrode made of La1-xSrxCo1-xFexO3 mixed with Sm0.2Ce0.8O1.9.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: Our approach combines X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and secondary ion mass spectrometry for surface and sub-surface analysis.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: Formation of Ruddlesden-Popper phase is accompanied by suppression of the A-site dopant segregation, and exsolution of catalytically active Co particles onto the surface.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: These findings reveal the chemical and structural elements that maintain an active surface for oxygen reduction, and the cathodic potential is one way to generate these desirable chemistries.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel and electrolysis cells suffer from surface instability which challenges their performance and durability.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential

Sentencas: Here, the authors report that cathodic polarization improves the electrochemical activity by formation of Ruddlesden-Popper phase, exsolution of Co, and suppression of Sr segregation.
Titulo: Improvement of oxygen reduction activity and stability on a perovskite oxide surface by electrochemical potential
